comments.body: Why not just use a plugin like Multiverse?
Oooh! This could be a way to sync up structure blocks between worlds.
Or you could have a command that works with this one. /SetWorldNum 1 (for lobby. 2,3,4,5 and so one would be /swap world 2.)
Would the worlds be sorted by numbers in order of first created?
I think this is an interesting idea. I would suggest making this possible for every block in the game, so you can choose which blocks are unbreakable even on creative with commands.

FlyDrop98 I never thought of that but I could totally see it as being useful, especially for other similar data-y blocks like structure, maybe even signs? There are lots of times in creative where you can instantly eliminate work in ways that would be impossible in survival. Another useful thing would be adding a confirmation to the /fill and /clone commands if you are filling or cloning over command blocks, just something that pops up in chat warning you before you fill over a whole array of command blocks. I think it would not be too impactful on performance as it essentially does the same thing as the replace parameter.
Use a sword, when in creative you cant destroy a block while holding a sword, but you can still right-click to open the command block menu

Luggibumm That does work but it's so impractical that it really doesn't help with the problem. As soon as you go to place a block or do anything else it opens you up to destroying stuff again, so it would not be much help overall. The idea I had was just something overall that completely prevents unintentional destruction of command blocks.
This could be something that is an option in command block interface + a block nbt tag that could be added by /blockdata command
I agree with this suggestion. Destroying Commandblock should not be as easy as one punch while in creative mode because miss-clicks happen..

/gamerule sendcommandfeedback false
it will give you the data on the command you just used, such as ‚Äúfilled 128 blocks‚Äù
JimTJones, that's really not what he means. Read it again. Also, it would be /gamerule sendcommandfeedback true, not false.

this is a great idea. 

plus, the addition of non-scoreboard variables and getting values from commands and putting them into a variable

This is already possible using the following commands in Java Edition:

/execute store result FakePlayer myObjective run fill 0 0 0 4 4 4 dirt
/tellraw @a {"score":{"name":"FakePlayer","objective":"myObjective"}}

In Bedrock Edition, I would advocate for getting the /stats command added to Bedrock Edition.
I think you can kick them in survival nocheats
You can kick with no cheats...
What if we just made @e work with dead mobs?

@e with dead mobs would be counter-intuitive (it could pick up mobs after /kill'ing them, which doesn't make sense) and also would break current datapacks. I suggesting adding a selector argument, "include_dead" (true/false) that determines whether the selector would pick up dead entities. On @e, the default is false for compatibility purposes, and on @a and @p and @s the default is true. It would also be nice if the flag is_alive was added to predicates.
How would this work???
That could work as well. I don't really care which way it's implemented. I just would really prefer if we could target dead mobs.

397083608132

When a mob dies, whether through the kill command or other means, they don't disappear instantly. For a short amount of time, they turn red and fall over, before being deleted from the world. During this time, the entity is still there, but it cannot be targeted by any target selectors (unless it is a dead player, which can be targeted using @a). This post is asking for the ability to target mobs while they are in that stage of death. I don't think the original poster meant that he wanted the ability to target mobs that have already been deleted from the world, which is something I oppose and probably what you thought when you saw this.

To people who may be confused: this would target mobs that have died but haven't been removed from the world yet, ie when they are colored red right before they poof. This would be useful because it would allow us to differentiate between when a mob unloads and when it is actually killed, for example.

Technically, @s can target dead mobs, but you would have to be executing as the dead entity already which isn't possible.
Dead mobs get unloaded when they die dont they. If they didnt, the game would have some lag issues
Or just take the existing @e and expand it with a [dead=true] to get the same effect
how would targeting dead mob be useful
What is the command supposed to do? you never explained it, just said certain things didnt work on bedrock edition
All of these are done through mods. Unless you are talking about piston doors, which ARE possible to make in bedrock edition.
It probably works on Java edition I saw a guy on YouTube named Eystreem he used the data pack in the video so it may work on Java
When are you going to release
No

Thing is we're likely never going to be able to directly modify player data because of how it works (it has something to do with needing to unload and reload the entity for the new data to apply, which for obvious reasons won't work for players since it would kick you out of single player worlds every time). So a specific command for the requested function is the only real option.
This is a very Nice idea
Is this talking about the F5 perspectives? And also may I ask how this could possibly help with mapmaking and minigames?

/locate the nearest possible monster spawn area (ignoring daylight and the player's proximity). This would have two functions: 1. make it easier to prevent monsters from spawning in an area 2. locate nearby dark caves.
I would like to be able to locate the dungeon structure

You should be able to locate itens and tagged itens, like /locate [type=item] {item:{tag: {display:{Name: "Spear"}}}} if your item is named spear, or just /locate item: minecraft:diamond_sword

And this should be added to bedrock too
I would like to be able to locate the dungeon and the desert well.

Some part of it should have a nether star/beacon with terracotta replaced with obsidian, and if in survival you should have to fuel it with XP bottles so it would still use XP but way harder to get. And only breakable with a diamond pickaxe.

Although it would make for an interesting adventure map, this feature would be totally game breaking as soon as someone gets their hands on one. Forget about having to fuel the thing, someone could simply give themselves however much of whatever item they desire!
Too OP and easy to abuse.
What about just giving access to arbitrary dimensions from ex. 0-255? (Make /tpx command vanilla)

@TakaoGamer1127 Oh so for example doing execute in minecraft:void1 run...? So the in subcommand could have the three dimensions (overworld, nether, end) and then not just one but multiple void dimensions? Cool idea.
How would people make a custom portal?
Could you change things such as the color of blocks, sky and build a new special portal to get there?

As a parent with a realm shared with family around the world, it would be very nice to disable or limit spawning of all sorts. (Ideally prevent spawn blocks and limit eggs use in a time period to 2 or 3)

A blanket disable on spawning would keep our world from being overrun constantly. :)
I would like to use a command block where the mob spawner can be turned on or off, so it can be unique to that spawner only - This could be very useful in map making.

(I wrote this here cuz the post would exceed 1500 words)

This suggestion has some potentials for map making. For instance,

1. string concatenation in general

2. showing scoreboard score on tooltip (pairing up with https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360011485651-String-type-for-execute-store-command)

3. health bar for non-custom mobs

4. custom durability bar

5. a whole keyboard input system

No comment on the suggestion itself, but in case you are unaware, you can modify a sign to the desired text component (using selector/score/whatever), and then use /data modify to copy it to the desired mob. So at least there is a workaround for now

You can actually do it (even if it's not the simplest way to do it) by copying those data into a sign, then those data are translated into fix JSON Compound, and you can copy them into entity's CustomName.
Ege ler
It should also be for eggs and fishing rods.
Yes this would be great; I'm trying to make a snowball fight datapack and its proving to be very difficult. This would be a great option for those people who want to make minigames with friends!
Did you finished the snowball datapack? I want it sooo badly
Yes, it can be turned on/off by command!
This can already be done with rx ry selectors.

Es la mejor idea que he visto igual que el hardcord para bedrock

Literally just /summon item ~ ~ ~ {Item:{id:"diamond",Count:3b}}

If you're talking about Bedrock, vote for NBT access instead
This will help so munch instead of having to use the setblock and clone command with a chess

Either this, or create an NBT tag that keeps armor stands in memory no matter where they are and where players are, so you can always teleport to them. E.g.:

"NoUnload: 1b"
This is not vanilla, those Java servers were using modified server jars or plugins that allow those commands

You can do this already with scoreboards,

Just create a runCode scoreboard in the dummy objective

set it to 0 at the beginning of the command,

use a conditional or an execute if to set it to 1

all commands after the potential set-to-1will have "execute if score x runCode matches 0 run "

before it, that way they will only run if you didn't "abort" the command chain by setting the score to 1
the explanations are a bit too technical for me, but I think your idea has potential. Can you give me specific examples?
369486931112, yes, but not in Bedrock. In Bedrock, there is almost no way to stop a command chain, except destroying it, and even then, if you replace it, it will keep going!
Great idea
Good idea
i love the idea! hope it becomes a reality one day!
I hope so too.

you could make "/gamerule showclouds look". This make the clouds looking for the block on their height. If they will detect something, the cloud getting in the block will be invisible until the cloud texture will start again.

Wait how is this any different than just having the players turn clouds off themselves?

Also we don't need a new gamerule for every tiny specific problem.

If it's a client-side thing, it shouldn't be a gamerule.

So no.
you can do this already

Having gotten into datapacks recently for 1.21.1+...
This would be extremely useful and cut down on many lines of commands

I would love this to have this. A syntax I've seen in other places that make more sense here is using the pipe character |:

$(macro1|323) $(macro2 | "this is a string")

when i saw my END superflat in vibrant visuals i thought i died and went to heaven... but alas true greatness will never be seen on console because parity holds up back from paramount creativity...
if i could link an image i'd surely show you all what we miss out on.

I will be showing as many players as i can this post. with hope, the command is added by next update. to the OP: i will try to reach out to minecraft youtubers and get exposure on the post. most people don't come on this sight after all... most people on here are PC players you see... so we need bedrock youtubers and the community there to be aware of bedrock posts, i think a separated section on this site for bedrock was needed but alas... parity..
I agree with this, mojang/microsoft needs to add it in future updates.
I agree 100% with this, this command should be usable by command blocks to simplify its usages.

I agree with that. I'm making a note block map, but I can't use the /tick command in the command block, so I'm having trouble making the map. It's hard to implement bpm, triplets!!

At least in a single world, the /tick command should be available in the command block
it's still there ya twit
It is already there, it‚Äôs in like the keybinds section in the settings or something. I know it‚Äôs there because I am using it right now.
